newsitem.title: GERMANY: N.Europe rapeseed market sees Scandinavian buyers.
newsitem.headline: N.Europe rapeseed market sees Scandinavian buyers.

text.p: Swedish and Danish crushers appeared in northern European rapeseed markets where trade buyers were also active, brokers said on Friday.
Rapeseed prices steadied due to rising demand and in sympathy with higher overnight Chicago soycomplex levels.
A lower 1996 rapeseed crop report also lent support.
Trader Toepfer today estimated the German crop at 2.5-2.6 million tonnes, down from 3.1 million last year, and down from June estimates of 2.5-2.7 milion tonnes.
Harvesting is in full swing across the country and yield outlooks are generally lower than last year's 3.2 tonnes/ha.
In addition, farmers complained about uneven ripening as well as high moisture and weed levels.
New crop seed was in short supply as traders and farmers either delivered against pre-harvest contracts or stored seed.
Trade buyers in the north offered 452.50 marks for August seed, five marks more than a week ago and ten marks up from levels four weeks ago.
The Scandinavian consumers reportedly paid 450 marks fob and 465 marks cif a tonne basis 2,000 tonne shipments.
German crushers were more reluctant because they were unhappy with oil and meal crush margins.
Rapeseed buyers at points other than Hamburg offered 447-455 marks for August and 460 for September fob Mittellandkanal.
French rapeseed fob Moselle cost 1,530 francs.
The November position on the Paris Matif futures exchange was last in a 451-456 marks bid/offer range in slim volume.
Local rape meal sellers quoted Aug/October (34 percent protein) at 27.50 marks/100 kg while Nov/Jan was at 28.25 marks. Prices were underpinned by latent feed mixer demand.
Sept rape oil was at 83.25 marks/100 kg, Oct at 84.50, and Nov-Jan at 86.50. --Vera Eckert, Hamburg newsroom, +49-40-41903275
